heading: Cataclysm Druid Endgame Build Guide
content: Welcome to the Cataclysm Druid Endgame Guide! The Druid distinguishes itself by significantly boosting its destructive power through guaranteed Overpowers. This build stands out as a prolific speedfarmer, but requires specific gear to get started and has a playstyle that takes some getting used to, especially when Bossing. To be transparent, this build is nerfed considerably from Season 8. had their multipliers significantly reduced and no longer has additive damage scaling based on Maximum and Fortified Life. Further, a rework to gives the build very stringent Cooldown requirements. All in all, the Cataclysm Druid still accomplishes plenty, but it is no longer miles ahead of the competition. Guaranteeing Overpowers is possible by synchronizing casts of with a fully stacked , and Critical Strike Chance is capped through Gear, Tempers, and Runes. Use one or more of to group mobs tightly together and overlap Strikes to improve damage. To get the build off the ground, it's imperative to acquire the build's core allows for some of the build's best available multipliers through itself, enables a host of synergies, including activating the Legendary Node and enabling groups mobs together and crucially has a high roll of Ultimate Cooldown Reduction. If you're not subscribed to their long Cooldown, is a great alternative to those skills. Generally hardcore and softcore share the same builds. Outside of being more prudent in your gameplay, you can also tweak the setup slightly to raise your survivability: Bosses are immune to Crowd Control (CC) effects and instead take Stagger Damage when hit by one. The amount of stagger damage dealt depends on the type of CC and is proportional to its duration. After being hit by a CC effect, the Boss will temporarily take less Stagger Damage from a CC of the same type. Effectively, this means that when you're just spamming one type of CC you don't need to spam any more of it than what you need to keep a normal enemy permanently CC-d. To stagger the Boss quickly you need to use as many different types of CC as possible. After the Boss is staggered it gains a certain amount of stacking Stagger Damage Reduction for the rest of the fight: Bosses naturally regain 1% of their Stagger HP every second and when that regen is combined with 90% Stagger Damage Reduction it becomes borderline impossible to Stagger the Boss again unless you bring a serious amount of crowd controls. Druid is a maelstrom of destruction, capable of almost immediately offscreening lesser foes while obtaining respectable marks in Pit Pushing. The initial snapshot and unintuitive boss mechanics are easy to learn but tough to master. However, the payoff for proper execution is tremendous and catapults the Cataclysm Druid into the upper echelon of Druid builds. Reviewed by
